Mostly for analysis:
First, import the pawp-set


```{r}
pawp <- data.frame(read.csv('pawpularity.csv'))
```

Turn everything except "pawpularity" into a factor

```{r}
columns <- colnames(pawp)
pawp$Subject.Focus <- factor(pawp$Subject.Focus)
pawp$Eyes <- factor(pawp$Eyes)
pawp$Face <- factor(pawp$Face)
pawp$Near <- factor(pawp$Near)
pawp$Action <- factor(pawp$Action)
pawp$Accessory <- factor(pawp$Group)
pawp$Group <- factor(pawp$Group)
pawp$Collage <- factor(pawp$Collage)
pawp$Human <- factor(pawp$Human)
pawp$Occlusion <- factor(pawp$Occlusion)
pawp$Info <- factor(pawp$Info)
pawp$Blur <- factor(pawp$Blur)
```

Simple multivariate analysis
```{r}
library('MGLM')
data <- pawp[,1:12]
mnreg <- MGLMreg(formula = Pawpularity ~ Subject.Focus + Eyes + Face + Near + Action + Accessory + Group + Collage + Human + Occlusion + Info + Blur , data = pawp, display = T)
```
